title: Cantilever Retaining Wall Design
problem: A 20-ft tall cantilever retaining wall retains granular backfill with $\gamma = 125$ pcf and $\phi = 32°$. The wall has a 2-ft thick base slab, 12-ft wide heel, and 3-ft toe. A surcharge of 200 psf is applied at the top. Calculate the active earth pressure resultant and factor of safety against overturning.
required: Calculate active earth pressure and factor of safety against overturning.

solution_steps.title: Calculate Active Earth Pressure from Soil
solution_steps.content:
$$p_a = K_a \gamma H = 0.307 \times 125 \times 20 = 767.5 \text{ psf}$$

$$P_a = \frac{1}{2} p_a H = \frac{1}{2} \times 767.5 \times 20 = 7,675 \text{ lb/ft}$$

Acts at $H/3 = 6.67$ ft from base

solution_steps.title: Calculate Surcharge Pressure
solution_steps.content:
$$p_q = K_a q = 0.307 \times 200 = 61.4 \text{ psf}$$

$$P_q = p_q H = 61.4 \times 20 = 1,228 \text{ lb/ft}$$

Acts at $H/2 = 10$ ft from base

solution_steps.title: Calculate Resisting Moment
solution_steps.content:
**Wall stem:** $M = 21,600$ lb-ft/ft
**Base slab:** $M = 33,750$ lb-ft/ft
**Soil on heel:** $M = 243,000$ lb-ft/ft

$$M_R = 298,350 \text{ lb-ft/ft}$$

final_answer: Total active earth pressure = 8,903 lb/ft. Factor of safety against overturning = **4.7**, which exceeds the minimum requirement of 2.0.

title: One-Way Slab Design
problem: Design a one-way slab spanning 10 feet between supports. The slab supports a superimposed dead load of 25 psf and live load of 100 psf. Use $f'_c = 4,000$ psi and Grade 60 reinforcement.
required: Determine slab thickness and required reinforcement.

solution_steps.title: Determine Minimum Slab Thickness
solution_steps.content:
Per ACI 318-19 Table 7.3.1.1:

For one-end continuous: $h_{min} = L/24 = 10 \times 12/24 = 5.0$ in

Use **h = 5 inches**

solution_steps.title: Calculate Loads
solution_steps.content:
Slab self-weight = $5/12 \times 150 = 62.5$ psf

Total dead load = $62.5 + 25 = 87.5$ psf

$$w_u = 1.2(87.5) + 1.6(100) = 265 \text{ psf}$$

solution_steps.title: Calculate Moments
solution_steps.content:
At interior support: $M_u = w_u L^2/11 = 2.41$ kip-ft/ft
At midspan: $M_u = w_u L^2/16 = 1.66$ kip-ft/ft

solution_steps.title: Calculate Required Reinforcement
solution_steps.content:
With $d = h - 0.75 - 0.25 = 4.0$ in:

$$A_s = \frac{M_u}{\phi f_y (d - a/2)} = 0.138 \text{ in}^2/\text{ft}$$

**Minimum reinforcement:**
$$A_{s,min} = 0.0018 \times 5 \times 12 = 0.108 \text{ in}^2/\text{ft}$$

Since $A_{s,required} > A_{s,min}$: Use $A_s = 0.16$ in²/ft

solution_steps.title: Select Reinforcement
solution_steps.content:
Use **#4 bars at 15 in** c/c:

$$A_s = 0.20 \times 12/15 = 0.16 \text{ in}^2/\text{ft}$$ ✓

final_answer: Use a **5-inch thick slab** with **#4 bars at 15 inches** on center. Temperature reinforcement: #3 at 12 in c/c.

title: Simple Shear Connection - Block Shear
problem: A single-plate connection uses (5) 3/4-inch A325-N bolts to connect a W18×35 beam to a W12×65 column. The beam end reaction is $R_u = 48$ kips. The beam has a 1.5-inch deep cope. Check block shear rupture capacity.

solution_steps.title: Determine Block Shear Geometry
solution_steps.content:
For 5 bolts in a vertical line with 3-inch pitch and 2.5-inch edge distance:

$$A_{nt} = (2.5 - 0.5 \times 0.875) \times 0.300 = 0.62 \text{ in}^2$$

$$A_{gv} = 14.5 \times 0.300 = 4.35 \text{ in}^2$$

$$A_{nv} = (14.5 - 4.5 \times 0.875) \times 0.300 = 3.17 \text{ in}^2$$

final_answer: Block shear capacity $\phi R_n = 123$ kips $> R_u = 48$ kips. The connection is **adequate** for block shear rupture.

title: HL-93 Live Load Moment
problem: Calculate the unfactored HL-93 live load moment for an interior girder of a simple span bridge. The span length is 85 ft, and girder spacing is 8.5 ft. The deck is 8 inches thick.
required: Calculate unfactored HL-93 live load moment at midspan.

solution_steps.title: Calculate Design Truck Moment
solution_steps.content:
For HL-93 design truck on 85 ft span:

$$M_{truck} = 1,350 \text{ kip-ft}$$ (single lane, from analysis)

solution_steps.title: Calculate Design Tandem Moment
solution_steps.content:
Design tandem = Two 25-kip axles at 4 ft spacing:

$$M_{tandem} = 1,065 \text{ kip-ft}$$

solution_steps.title: Combine HL-93 Load Effects
solution_steps.content:
HL-93 is the larger of:

**Case 1:** Truck + Lane = 1,350 + 578 = 1,928 kip-ft
**Case 2:** Tandem + Lane = 1,065 + 578 = 1,643 kip-ft

**Controlling:** Case 1 with Design Truck

solution_steps.title: Apply Distribution Factor
solution_steps.content:
From AASHTO Table 4.6.2.2.2b-1:
$$g \approx 0.55$$ (for two or more lanes)

$$M_{LL} = g \times (M_{truck} \times 1.33 + M_{lane})$$
$$M_{LL} = 0.55 \times (1,350 \times 1.33 + 578) = 1,306 \text{ kip-ft}$$

final_answer: The unfactored HL-93 live load moment is **1,306 kip-ft** (includes 33% impact). For Strength I, apply $\gamma_{LL} = 1.75$.
